index.html.title: Georgia SKYWARN Spotter Dashboard
index.html.description: Main dashboard with Hazardous Weather Outlook, spotter activation status, and active alerts

sections.heading: Georgia SKYWARN Spotter Dashboard
sections.preview: Real-time dashboard for Georgia SKYWARN weather spotters. Displays current Hazardous Weather Outlook from NWS Atlanta, spotter activation status, and all active weather alerts.

sections.heading: Spotter Activation Status
sections.preview: Shows current spotter activation level (Activated/Monitor/Standby) based on NWS Hazardous Weather Outlook. Auto-refreshes every 4 hours.

sections.heading: Active Area Alerts
sections.preview: Displays all active warnings (red), watches (orange), and alerts (blue) from NWS Atlanta forecast office. Auto-refreshes every 5 minutes.

sections.heading: Quick Maps & Radar
sections.preview: Essential weather and situational awareness tools including NWS Atlanta Radar, Linked Repeater Map, NWSChat Map, ARES Southeast Map, GEMA Dashboard, and NWS Weather Hazards.

spotters.html.title: Spotter Resources & Training
spotters.html.description: Comprehensive spotter resources including training materials, reporting guidelines, and NWS contacts

sections.heading: NWS Spotter Resources
sections.preview: Spotter training schedules, quick reference handouts, SKYWARN guidebook, storm report submission, radar access, repeater maps, and NWS Atlanta social media connections.

sections.heading: SKYWARN Information
sections.preview: What is SKYWARN? Volunteer program by NWS that trains citizens to spot and report severe weather. Learn about net activation protocol and reporting best practices.

sections.heading: Reporting Requirements
sections.preview: Learn what to report: tornadoes, funnel clouds, hail (with size), damaging winds (≥50 mph), flooding, winter weather, and lightning. Includes reporting guidelines and format.

sections.heading: Submit Reports
sections.preview: Submit storm reports via NWS website, phone (866-763-4466 for severe weather, 770-486-1133 main office), or EchoLink node KK4GQ-R connected to 145.210- (131.8 Hz).

repeaters.html.title: SKYWARN Repeaters
repeaters.html.description: Complete list of Georgia SKYWARN linked and non-linked repeaters plus NOAA Weather Radio stations

sections.heading: Search Repeaters
sections.preview: Search all SKYWARN repeaters and weather stations by location, frequency, or callsign. Use Ctrl+K (Cmd+K on Mac) keyboard shortcut.

sections.heading: Georgia SKYWARN Linked Repeater System
sections.preview: Primary Georgia SKYWARN linked repeater network. Many repeaters part of Southeastern Linked Repeater Net (meets Wednesdays at 9 PM Eastern since 1993).

sections.heading: Local SKYWARN Nets (Not-Linked)
sections.preview: Local county SKYWARN repeaters activated by County SKYWARN coordinators or EMA. Not linked to state-wide network. Reports passed to WX4PTC or NWS.

sections.heading: NOAA Weather Radio Stations
sections.preview: NOAA Weather Radio transmitters (17 stations) operated by NWS. Continuous weather broadcasts, warnings, watches, and forecasts 24/7 on VHF frequencies 162.400-162.550 MHz.

sections.heading: Export to Radio Programming Software
sections.preview: Export SKYWARN repeater data to CSV format for CHIRP or RT Systems radio programming software. Includes import instructions and download links.

nwsffclinks.html.title: NWS Useful Links
nwsffclinks.html.description: Comprehensive collection of NWS Atlanta and national weather resources

sections.heading: Core NWS Atlanta Resources
sections.preview: Essential NWS Atlanta resources: main FFC webpage, national radar, IDSS point forecasts, weather observations, and weather safety information.

sections.heading: Decision Support Tools
sections.preview: NWS Atlanta Decision Support Services for emergency managers and the Damage Assessment Toolkit (DAT) for viewing and reporting storm damage.

sections.heading: River & Flooding Information
sections.preview: River levels, flood forecasts, Flood Inundation Mapping (FIM), and training resources for NWS Atlanta area waterways and flood prediction.

sections.heading: Specialized Weather Information
sections.preview: Specialized weather info: winter weather forecasts, fire weather/red flag warnings, GDOT road weather stations, and GEMA All Hazards Dashboard.

sections.heading: National Weather Centers
sections.preview: National weather centers: Storm Prediction Center (severe weather outlooks), Weather Prediction Center (national forecasts), National Hurricane Center (tropical storms).

wx4ptc.html.title: WX4PTC - NWS Peachtree City Amateur Radio Station
wx4ptc.html.description: Information about the WX4PTC SKYWARN Net Control station at NWS Peachtree City

sections.heading: Station Overview
sections.preview: WX4PTC is the amateur radio call sign for SKYWARN Net Control at NWS Peachtree City. Equipped with dual-band VHF/UHF radios, HF transceiver, and hub repeater on 444.600 MHz (+5 MHz, 77.0 Hz PL).

sections.heading: Spotter Activation
sections.preview: NWS issues Hazardous Weather Outlook when severe weather expected. Warnings Coordinator contacts WX4PTC team. ARES/SKYWARN volunteers staff the station and open the net.

sections.heading: Activation Flow
sections.preview: Activation process: NWS issues statement → Warnings Coordinator activates WX4PTC → Net operates on linked repeaters → Spotters submit reports via radio, phone (866-763-4466), or online.

sections.heading: Net Operations
sections.preview: SKYWARN net is a directed net. All traffic goes through net control. Spotters check-in on linked repeaters. Priority reports relayed directly to NWS to avoid congestion.

sections.heading: Photo Archive
sections.preview: View archived photos of the WX4PTC station including operating positions, equipment, antennas, and station setup (circa 2002).

about.html.title: About Georgia SKYWARN
about.html.description: Information about the Georgia SKYWARN website, site structure, and contacts

sections.heading: About This Site
sections.preview: Central hub for Georgia SKYWARN linked repeater system coordinating severe weather reporting across 96 counties. Mobile-first design, WCAG 2.1 AA compliant, built with HTML5/CSS3/vanilla JavaScript.

sections.heading: Contacts
sections.preview: Key contacts: Robert Burton (KD4YDC) DEC ARES/NWS, Lynn Bianco (KN4YZ) Fayette County EC, David Christie (N5JEY) Assistant DEC, David Nadler NWS Warnings Coordinator, Jack Parks (KQ4JP) Webmaster.

sections.heading: Service Area of NWS Atlanta
sections.preview: NWS Atlanta issues warnings for 96 counties in northern and central Georgia (CWA - County Warning Area). View forecast area maps and coverage zones.

sections.heading: Site Update Log
sections.preview: Recent website updates, new features, bug fixes, and improvements to the Georgia SKYWARN site.

photoarchive.html.title: WX4PTC Station Photo Archive
photoarchive.html.description: Historical photos of the WX4PTC amateur radio station at NWS Peachtree City (circa 2002)

sections.heading: Station Photo Gallery (circa 2002)
sections.preview: Visual tour of WX4PTC station: operating positions with Icom IC207 and Kenwood TS570SG radios, dual-monitor system with radar/EMWIN/APRS, packet station, antenna array on 40 ft Rohn 45 tower, and grounding system.
